Column Comment.0: INSTRUMENT ID: Unique identifier for the instrument.
Column Comment.1: DETAIL IDENTIFER: Unique identifier for detail record about an instrument.
Column Comment.2: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.3: AVERAGE VALUE: The average or single value assigned to this specification. If onlyone mesuare is provided, it should be stored here.
Column Comment.6: COST: A value associated with the cost of a specification, such as annual operatingcost.
Column Comment.7: CURRENCY CONVERSION: A number which, when multipled by the stored value,will re-create the original value in the original currency used.
Column Comment.8: CURRENCY ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE: The units of measure in which thecurrency was originally received.
Column Comment.10: DETAIL DESCRIPTION: A narrative version of the detail in the instrument.
Column Comment.11: EFFECTIVE DATE: date on which the data in this row came into effect.
Column Comment.12: EXPIRY DATE: Date on which the data in this row of data was no longer in effect.
Column Comment.13: INSTRUMENT DETAIL CODE: In the case that the instrument detail is described asa coded value, this provides the valid code for each type of detail.
Column Comment.14: INSTRUMENT DETAIL TYPE: The kind of detail information about the instrumentthat has been stored.
Column Comment.15: MAXIMUM DATE: the maximum date, such as an expiry date, that describes thisproduct.
Column Comment.16: MAXIMUM VALUE: the maximum value for a specification, such as the maximumdiameter of a tank, or the maximum load capacity of a vehicle.
Column Comment.19: MINUMUM DATE: the minimum date associated with a specification, such as a datethat a product cannot be used for, such as for aging processes.
Column Comment.20: MINIMUM VALUE: the minimum value associated with a specification, such asminimum pipe thickness or minimum pressure capability.
Column Comment.23: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.24: REFERENCE VALUE: the value of a reference point. For example may be a date orevent, or a process.
Column Comment.26: INSTRUMENT DETAIL REFERENCE VALUE TYPE: In the case where a detail isreferenced to some other value (such as a submission due after a certain period, or adate or an activity), the type of reference value is captured here. The values, ifrelevant, are stored in associated column
Column Comment.28: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.29: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.30: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.31: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.32: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.33: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.34: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.35: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.36: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
